definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
ghoulies and bogeys/things that go bump in the night

sentences.english: Dickinson introduced Gothic to her poetry and applied many images of ghosts and goblins.
sentences.chinese: 狄金森將哥特體引入詩歌，使用了很多鬼怪類的意象。

sentences.english: According to legend, during the Han Dynasty, the King of Huainan, Liu An, is especially keen on books about immortals and ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 相傳漢朝的淮南王劉安特別喜愛看描寫神仙鬼怪的書。

sentences.english: One felt that the chief of this barricade was a geometrician or a spectre.
sentences.chinese: 我們感到這個街壘的首領是一個幾何學家或一個鬼怪。

sentences.english: Others too have seen spirits in the Enchanted Woods.
sentences.chinese: 也有其他人在這魔幻森林裏見過精靈鬼怪。

sentences.english: On halloween , people burn the fire to drive the evils away.
sentences.chinese: 萬聖節時人麼點燃熊熊大火來驅逐妖魔鬼怪。

sentences.english: I am reading a book about ghosts and other supernatural sightings.
sentences.chinese: 我正在讀的這本書講的是鬼怪和其他一些超自然的事。

sentences.english: She was full of fear to hear the story about the ghosts and the monsters.
sentences.chinese: 她滿懷恐懼地聽那些妖魔鬼怪的故事。

sentences.english: Let's have a look at the list of Russian evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 下面就讓我們看看俄羅斯的鬼怪和精靈。

sentences.english: The OTV spaceplane was built at a Boeing Phantom Works facility in Southern California.
sentences.chinese: 該OTV航天飛機建於波音鬼怪工程南加州設施。

sentences.english: His ghost story made my flesh creep.
sentences.chinese: 他的鬼怪故事使我汗毛直豎。

sentences.english: I had read of such hideous incarnate demons.
sentences.chinese: 我讀過關於這類可怕的化身鬼怪的書。

sentences.english: Robe-clad figures moved among the tents like specters.
sentences.chinese: 穿着長袍的人影如鬼怪般在帳間遊走。

sentences.english: And above all, don't you HANDLE the witch-things.
sentences.chinese: 頂頂要緊的是，你別去碰那些妖魔鬼怪的東西。

sentences.english: When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified.
sentences.chinese: 門徒看見他在海面上走，就驚慌了，說，是個鬼怪。

sentences.english: As a DDM creature, the Lamia is sort of weird.
sentences.chinese: 身爲一個龍與地下城戰棋生物，拉米雅屬於鬼怪類型。

sentences.english: The Celtics also offered the ghosts good things to eat.
sentences.chinese: 居爾特人也會準備美食給陰間的鬼怪。

definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
supernatural being (such as a demon, monster, ghost, spirit, gremlin etc)
Two deities, one short, one tall, chained together at the ankle, responsible for rewarding the good and punishing the bad
